projects.name: Vigenère Cipher CLI
projects.description: C++ command-line tool to encrypt and decrypt text with the Vigenère cipher, including basic input validation and file-based workflows for learning classical cryptography.

projects.name: Malware Analysis Sandbox
projects.description: Flask-based malware sandbox that lets users upload files, calculates hashes, and submits them to external scanning services, providing a safe environment to practice triaging suspicious samples.

projects.name: Windows Backup Automation
projects.description: Automated backup solution for Windows machines: weekly full mirrors with Copy-Item and daily incrementals via Robocopy, scheduled with Task Scheduler and logged for quick verification.

projects.name: Hackazon Security Assessment
projects.description: End-to-end security assessment of the intentionally vulnerable Hackazon e-commerce platform. Deployed the app with Docker, ran authenticated Burp Suite scans, verified XSS and SQL injection manually (and with sqlmap), and documented findings and mitigations as part of a capstone project.

projects.name: Python Blockchain Ledger
projects.description: Educational blockchain implementation with signed transactions, balance tracking, basic staking and slashing logic, and block validation. Exposed through a FastAPI REST API and a WebSocket peer-to-peer layer for experimenting with consensus behavior.

projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.description: This portfolio site: a React + Redux SPA backed by a JSON-server API. Uses async thunks to fetch projects, skills, certifications, and comments, with reusable components, routing, and a contact form wired into a feedback endpoint.

comments.text: Thorough Hackazon write-up. Good mix of automated scanning and manual verification of findings.
comments.author: Security Lab Instructor

comments.text: Malware sandbox UI is clean and straightforward. Nice starting point for practicing basic triage.
comments.author: Peer Reviewer

comments.text: PowerShell backup scripts work reliably and the logging makes it easy to confirm everything ran.
comments.author: Internal Project Mentor

skills.name: Python
skills.description: Primary language for scripting and back-end work. Built a Flask malware-analysis sandbox, an educational blockchain ledger (FastAPI + WebSockets), and multiple data-processing scripts using Pandas and type hints.

skills.name: C / C++
skills.description: Implemented cryptography-focused labs (RSA, MD5 collision, hash length extension) and a CLI banking app that talks to SQL Server via ODBC; comfortable with pointers, memory management, and basic build tooling.

skills.name: Git & GitHub
skills.description: Use Git daily across personal projects and coursework. Comfortable with branching, rebasing, resolving merge conflicts, and managing pull requests on GitHub for portfolio projects and labs.

skills.name: Node.js & Express
skills.description: Built REST APIs with Express, including auth middleware, centralized error handling, and logging with Morgan. Used Express and JSON Server to mock back-ends while developing React front-ends.

skills.name: Docker
skills.description: Use Docker and docker-compose to spin up reproducible lab environments (Hackazon, databases, and Python services). Wrote basic Dockerfiles for Python apps and debugged container networking and volume issues.

skills.name: Burp Suite
skills.description: Used Burp Suite Professional to perform authenticated dynamic scans of Hackazon, tuned scan configurations, and used Repeater/Intruder for manual XSS and SQL injection testing with professional-style reports.

skills.name: React + Redux
skills.description: Built this portfolio with React hooks, React Router, and Redux Toolkit slices for projects, skills, certifications, and comments. Implemented async thunks for API calls and loading/error UI states.

skills.name: Sqlmap
skills.description: Automated detection and exploitation of SQL injection in Hackazon’s API and back-end, using sqlmap to enumerate databases and generate proof-of-concept evidence where appropriate.

skills.name: Bootstrap
skills.description: Use Bootstrap and Reactstrap for quick, responsive layouts: navbars, cards, grids, and modals. Comfortable customizing spacing, typography, and theming instead of leaving everything at the defaults.

skills.name: Network & Security Tools
skills.description: Hands-on with Nmap, Netdiscover, Wireshark, and OpenSSL for host discovery, port scanning, packet analysis, and TLS inspection. Regularly used in labs while studying for CompTIA Network+.

skills.name: SQL
skills.description: Write multi-table joins, subqueries, and basic window functions in MySQL and SQL Server. Designed normalized schemas and tuned indexes for small lab projects.

skills.name: Linux
skills.description: Comfortable in Ubuntu, Kali, and other distributions. Use Bash for automation, manage services with systemd, configure SSH and basic firewall rules, and troubleshoot networking and permissions issues.

skills.name: PowerShell
skills.description: Authored scripts for a two-tier Windows backup strategy: weekly full mirrors and daily incrementals using Copy-Item and Robocopy, all scheduled and logged automatically.

certifications.name: B.S. in Computer Science (Cybersecurity)
certifications.description: Liberty University, May 2025 — Concentration in Cybersecurity; coursework included networking, cryptography, secure software development, and ethical hacking.

certifications.name: Nucamp Full-Stack Web Development Bootcamp
certifications.description: Completed July 2024 — Built full-stack apps with React, Node, Express, and MongoDB, including authentication and RESTful APIs.

certifications.name: CompTIA Network+ (N10-008) — In Progress
certifications.description: Actively studying routing and switching, wireless, virtualization, and network security while applying concepts in home lab environments.

certifications.name: CompTIA Security+ — Planned
certifications.description: Planned next after Network+ to formalize knowledge of risk management, identity and access management, and secure network design.
